result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonti Lamar Miles

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on March 7, 2023 at 02:15 pm.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:36 PM Defendant Deonti Lamar Miles appeared by video.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Deonti Lamar Miles.  Attorney David S Olson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 03:17 AM Defendant Deonti Lamar Miles appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David S Olson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address and date of birth verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000.00   with conditions Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance. Maintain absolute sobriety. Adjourned initial appearance October 5, 2022 at 1:00 pm.

Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
